GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1966 F-100 4x4 Short Box Pickup. It is a treat to see one of these old pick-ups in such tremendously great shape as they were notoriously beaten up on farms and construction sites. This retired work horse was built on a 1987 Bronco 4x4 chassis.  The conversion was done very well and everything fits appropriately and the 4x4 functions properly.  The body remains in great condition and presents very well.  It features a carbureted 302 v8 with power steering and power brakes.  It has a Edelbrock carburetor and intake.  Other features include Warn hubs, tow hitch, dual exhasut, 33x13.5x15 Super Swamper tires.

The '66 Ford F100 4x4 is among the 4th generation of Ford trucks.  These trucks are a very desirable body style in the classic world today representing the legendary work horses. This truck is ready for its next owner.

Gr Auto Gallery, LLC and our sister company, Wheelz Sales and Leasing Inc. makes every effort to represent each vehicle accurately and with integrity. We also welcome third party inspections when necessary. Although we try to do our very best to be accurate in our description writing we are human and do make mistakes. Unless otherwise noted, All vehicles are sold AS IS, No Warranty Expressed or Implied. All sales final.

One of the best body styling for a Ford pick-up truck would be the unibody.  This 1961 example does not disappoint.  It is a 1961 Ford F100 Custom Cab short bed Unibody.  Beautiful red exterior with black interior.  Power leather seats.  Beautifully finished wood bed.  Great choice of wheels.  The exhaust really allows this truck to sound as good if not better than it looks.  The Mopar 383 cu-in V8 gives the truck plenty of power.  This truck also handles very well.  The automatic transmission and power steering also help to make this truck very easy and fun to drive.

1967 marked the first year of a six-year production cycle representing the fifth generation of the venerable Ford F-Series trucks. Changes included sharper styling lines a larger cab and expanded engine options. Three trim levels were offered. The base or "??Custom"? "??Custom Cab"? and top-of-the-line "??Ranger"?. Within this group the grille exterior trim interior cab fittings and engine choices were unique in the 1967 model year. The base powerplant was a 240 cid inline 6 while the king of the road sported a 390 cid (6.4L) V8. This 1967 Pearl White beauty boasts 390 V8 power mated to a 3-speed automatic transmission. The black/white vinyl bench seat is very comfortable and provide are great view of the road ahead. Additional features of this mostly stock vehicle include AM/FM/CD stereo and solid oak bed. This sharp 1967 Ford F100 Pickup Truck is located at our Milwaukee showroom. You can view this vehicle in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video of it running and driving at Gatewayclassiccars.com. Our 1963 Ford F100 unibody pickup is finished in raven black with white trim and a gray vinyl and white trim interior. The '63 is an older cosmetic restoration and it still looks solid without any major scratches or dents. When you look down the sides of the truck both sides along with the front and back are clean and straight.

Open the door of the Ford and you have a clean barely worn interior. There is fresh upholstery that doesn't show much wear. The bench seat is grey vinyl with black vinyl floor mats and black trim throughout, with a white dash cluster. Sit in the driver's seat and turn the ignition key to fire up the 223-cubic inch inline 6 and it starts up quickly. The Ford has the original 3-speed column manual transmission which shifts smoothly. With only 78,674 miles showing on the odometer it is clean and ready for a drive. Most of the '63's have been upgraded, customized or setup as street or hot rods. Today, very few are found in their original state.
This '63 Ford F100 won't last long, call or email us today with any questions!

This 1964 Ford F100 FDNY 911 Tribute truck honors the FDNY, which lost 343 Firefighters on 911.
It includes fire helmets, a bunker coat, 12 polished fire extinguishers, a polished siren, a PA system, a working fire department radio, a revolving light and 4 actual FDNY firehouse log books.

Complete frame-off restoration. The truck was disassembled, the frame sandblasted and painted, all body panels taken down to bare metal and repainted. The engine, transmission and shifter were overhauled. All shocks and the rear springs were replaced. Front brakes replaced with power disk unit. The truck starts, runs and drives as new. It has been used less than 40 miles since rebuild. It is a great parade vehicle.

Engine is 223 cu in six cylinder, 3 speed manual trans, 3.89:1 rear end. Vehicle was originally in Arizona. There are no rust issues anywhere on the frame or body. It has the original toolboxes, which have been blasted and paintted.
You can look a long time and not see another truck like this one.
With its glossy red paint, custom two-tone interior, and original large V8 under the hood, this 1966 Ford F-100 is the kind of classic that offers far more than its value price would suggest.

Like any good workman truck, the Fords of this era were not trying to be too showy, but this Custom Cab has just the right amount of added panache.  Chrome bumpers, a hint of a cowl hood, and the sleek flair side style give this instant vintage appeal.  Plus, the full-length white trim strip really stands out nicely against the resprayed factory-correct Rangoon Red paint.  The same goes for the factory wheel covers.  But some of the great-looking pieces also help this remain function pickup.  After all, those bed rails attract attention, and when combined with the red liner paint in the bed, this is the affordable classic that's also your friend for weekend chores.

The red with white trim theme is continued inside, and black is also added for distinction.  You'll love showing off the bench that has custom piping and comfortable cloth inserts for the driver and passenger. There's also an upgrade to an AM/FM/cassette radio, but everything else is pure '60s nostalgia.  You'll grab the classic Ford three-spoke steering wheel, and just ahead of that are the original gauges in a machine-turned surround.  Below that, the original instruments are still in place and are fully functional, right down to the hear/defrost controls.   So this pickup provides the perfect vintage atmosphere.

Under the hood is an exceptionally honest looking 352 cubic-inch V8.  According to the consignor, this is the original motor to the truck, and it certainly looks the part.  More than just the originality, you'll love this because the Y-code motor was the largest offered by Ford that year.  With this kind of power and torque at the ready, it's great to see a trailer hitch attachment to this truck.  But even if you don't do any hauling, the well-matched gears in the three-speed manual transmission keeps up with traffic quite nicely.  Plus, Ford's twin I-beam front suspension, an upgraded aluminum radiator, and modern Hankook tires make this versatile classic a fine cruiser.

Complete with owner's manual and original bill of sale, this is your opportunity to pay a little and get a lot.  Vintage pickups are hot, and this well-sorted and stylish F-100 is well within any budget. Call now!

For sale in out Nashville Tennessee showroom is a stunning and sinister 1953 Ford F100 Stepside. Powering this Ford F100 Stepside for sale is a GM350CID V8 built Ford tough with Chevy stuff! Backing this power-plant is a GM 3-speed automatic could be a TH350 or a Turbo400 I have not counted pan bolts and the owner could not confirm. As you gaze at this sexy beast of a machine you will be mesmerized by the as I would call it a Metallic Gloss Matte finish now I know that you can"??t go to the paint shop and say I want this color but this is how it laid on this truck after it dried and cured. As you crawl inside the cabin of this beast you can rest your booty on a freshly laid leather bench seat that stretches from side to side relax and enjoy the tilt Colum giving you the creature comforts that you would expect in a late model. You can kick back and lean into the pedal and hear the unhumble rumble of the GM power. This is you chance to own a piece of history and class do not be the one to miss out.  Options and features of this 1953 Ford F100 Stepside for sale include: Power steering Power Brakes Upgraded Gauge cluster Plush leather seating Radial performance tires wrapped around a custom set of staggered stance aluminum alloy wheels.
